question_text: For the byte 01011001, what parity bit calculation would detect if a single bit error occurred during storage or retrieval?
answer_options: Add a 0 parity bit for even parity
Add a 1 parity bit for even parity
Use two parity bits for double protection
correct_answer: Add a 0 parity bit for even parity
explanation: The byte has 4 ones (even), so a 0 parity bit maintains even parity. If any single bit changes, the parity check will fail and detect the error.
